name: Sky plc
goal:
Sky is Europe's leading entertainment company, serving 23 million customers across six countries: UK, Ireland, Germany, Austria, Italy and Spain. We offer the best and broadest range of content, deliver market-leading customer service and use innovative new technology to give customers a better TV experience, whenever and wherever they choose.

Sky has annual revenues of over £13 billion and is Europe's leading investor in television content with a combined programming budget of over £6.5 billion. The group employs 31,000 people and is listed on the London Stock Exchange (SKY).

For more information visit www.sky.com/corporate
interests: Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Energy, Environment, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: Main focus is on the Digital Single Market, including copyright, audiovisual media, electronic communications, e-commerce, competition, consumer rights and privacy. We also follow environmental files, in particular those linked to Ocean health.
